text: The Duke of Cambridge has paid tribute to his mother, saying she still inspires'countless acts of compassion and bravery ', as he presented an inaugural award celebrating her memory. With brother Prince Harry beside him, the future king told the 20 young recipients of the Legacy Award that Diana, Princess of Wales had achieved so much in her life, from helping to fight the stigma around Aids to supporting the homeless. The royal brothers were making their first joint appearance at an event run by the Diana Award, established to promote their mother's belief in the positive power of young people. Scroll down for video Princes William and Harry presented 20 young winners with The Diana Award at St James's Palace on Thursday.
